critique: The document outlines the establishment of the Federal Power Commission to aid in the development of water power and transmission of electrical energy. As the President, the primary emotions I want to elicit are joy and surprise, as this initiative aims to improve infrastructure and provide economic opportunities. There might be some fear and disgust from those who oppose government intervention, and sadness from those who feel left out. The language is formal and authoritative, which doesn't strongly convey any particular emotion. The context of the Great Depression suggests a need for hope and progress.
